pr_title: Home page -- Fixes axeDev tools + lighthouse error and makes the lighthouse score to 1
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR adds tabindices for the splash page sections for users using screenreader

## Essential Checklist

- [x] The **PR title** starts with "Fix #bugnum: " or "Fix part of #bugnum: ...",
followed by a short, clear summary of the changes.
- [x] I have followed the [instructions for making a code change](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Make-a-pull-request).
- [x] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed on my local machine.
- [x] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
- [x] I have assigned the correct reviewers to this PR (or will leave a
comment with the phrase "@{{reviewer_username}} PTAL" if I don't have
permissions to assign reviewers directly).


## Testing doc (for PRs with Beam jobs that modify production server data)

<!--
If this PR affects production server data, please follow
[these instructions](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Testing-jobs-and-other-features-on-production#submitting-a-pr-with-a-new-job-or-feature-that-requires-third-party-api)
and link to the job request doc here.

Otherwise, please delete this section.
-->

## Proof that changes are correct

https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/4ac4b6a1-b2ce-4d45-9c91-331870eee868


https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/7b0ed166-cf95-456d-bd9e-b3dd1c59182d


<!--
Add videos/screenshots of the user-facing interface to demonstrate that the changes
made in this PR work correctly. If this PR is for a developer-facing feature,
provide the videos/screenshots of developer-facing interface.

Please also include videos/screenshots of the developer tools
browser console, so that we can be sure that there are no console errors.

If the changes in your PRs are autogenerated via a script and you cannot provide proof
for the changes then please leave a comment "No proof of changes needed because {{Reason}}"
and remove all the sections below.
-->

#### Proof of changes
- Desktop
![Screenshot 2023-06-29 105506](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/b705d952-3e26-4d14-85d8-b4ea210232dc)

- Mobile Phone
![Screenshot 2023-06-29 122506](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/37731de4-0b7c-4db7-bec2-98c294833808)
![Screenshot 2023-06-29 122418](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/81490247-6d38-44bc-9523-398a84e2d0e2)


<!--
Make sure to properly verify that everything works correctly, and that there are
no weird UI mistakes or other problems. Also, if there are any newly added fields,
try to fill them out and test that different inputs are correctly accepted/rejected.

Throttle the network (to 3G) using the browser Developer Tools (see references below).
There should be no performance or UI issues while the network is slow.

References:
 - Chrome: https://css-tricks.com/throttling-the-network/
 - Firefox: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Network_Monitor/Throttling
-->

<!--
In some cases this is not needed (e.g. for pages that we do not expect to
support mobile phones, or for backend-only features).

Feel free to use the Developer Tools emulator for this.

References:
 - Chrome: https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/device-mode/
 - Firefox: https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/devtools-user/index.html#responsive-design-mode
-->


<!--
If the PR changes the UI, make sure to add screenshots with the site
language set to Arabic as well (we use Arabic as it is a language written from right to left).
-->

## PR Pointers

- Never force push! If you do, your PR will be closed.
- Make sure your PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays.
- Some e2e tests are flaky, and can fail for reasons unrelated to your PR. We are working on fixing this, but in the meantime, if you need to restart the tests, please check the ["If your build fails" wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/If-CI-checks-fail-on-your-PR).
- See the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia's-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers) for what code owners will expect.

pr_title: Fix axeDev tools + lighthouse error for learner dashboard and make the lighthouse score to 1
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes the axe devtools errors and lighthouse errors for learner dashboard
2. This PR does the following: Adds aria-label, img alt text and keyboard support for the feedback table in learner dashboard

## Essential Checklist

- [x] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [x] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed locally on your machine.
- [x] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
  - This lets reviewers restart your CircleCI tests for you.
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".

pr_title: Fix navbar issues while navigating using screen reader + link is not focusable in progress tab + updated feedback warning position
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes parts of the Project Manager demo remarks for my GSoC project -- Improve accessibility
2. This PR does the following: 
- Fix the navbar navigation issues while using the screen-reader.
- The dropdowns are not closing automatically when the focus is shifted to another tab.
- For the Home and the Donate tabs on the navbar, chromevox should not be reading them as “collapsed”.
- The “setting a goal!” link in the Progress tab is not accessible.
- Move the disclaimer text above the ‘send’ button on the feedback updates tab
- Fix the the “Skip to main content” 

References: 
- https://ng-bootstrap.github.io/#/components/dropdown/api
- https://www.scope.org.uk/

## Essential Checklist

- [x] The **PR title** starts with "Fix #bugnum: " or "Fix part of #bugnum: ...",
followed by a short, clear summary of the changes.
- [x] I have followed the [instructions for making a code change](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Make-a-pull-request).
- [x] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed on my local machine.
- [x] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
- [x] I have assigned the correct reviewers to this PR (or will leave a
comment with the phrase "@{{reviewer_username}} PTAL" if I don't have
permissions to assign reviewers directly).


<!--
If this PR affects production server data, please follow
[these instructions](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Testing-jobs-and-other-features-on-production#submitting-a-pr-with-a-new-job-or-feature-that-requires-third-party-api)
and link to the job request doc here.

Otherwise, please delete this section.
-->

## Proof that changes are correct

Moved the warning before the send button:

https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/954bd9fc-46e7-488f-a35b-57969dea11bf

Focus is going to "setting a goal":

https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/2481810d-fcc5-4dc9-a30c-1e107aeaff42


Navbar dropdown closing when focus is moving to next option:

https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/d5a27f72-482e-4eed-96a3-5108b493e21e


Skip to main content:

https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/d01e6cee-2bbc-4fa1-ab01-ddad5820212e



<!--
Add videos/screenshots of the user-facing interface to demonstrate that the changes
made in this PR work correctly. If this PR is for a developer-facing feature,
provide the videos/screenshots of developer-facing interface.

Please also include videos/screenshots of the developer tools
browser console, so that we can be sure that there are no console errors.

The above should be done for all PRs, including short ones (e.g. a single-line change).
However, if the changes in your PRs are autogenerated via a script and you cannot
provide proof for the changes then please leave a comment "No proof of changes
needed because {{Reason}}" and remove all the sections below.
-->


<!--
Make sure to properly verify that everything works correctly, and that there are
no weird UI mistakes or other problems. Also, if there are any newly added fields,
try to fill them out and test that different inputs are correctly accepted/rejected.

Throttle the network (to 3G) using the browser Developer Tools (see references below).
There should be no performance or UI issues while the network is slow.

References:
 - Chrome: https://css-tricks.com/throttling-the-network/
 - Firefox: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Network_Monitor/Throttling
-->


<!--
In some cases this is not needed (e.g. for pages that we do not expect to
support mobile phones, or for backend-only features).

Feel free to use the Developer Tools emulator for this.

References:
 - Chrome: https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/device-mode/
 - Firefox: https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/devtools-user/index.html#responsive-design-mode
-->


<!--
If the PR changes the UI, make sure to add screenshots with the site
language set to Arabic as well (we use Arabic as it is a language written from right to left).
-->

## PR Pointers

- Never force push! If you do, your PR will be closed.
- Make sure your PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays.
- Some e2e tests are flaky, and can fail for reasons unrelated to your PR. We are working on fixing this, but in the meantime, if you need to restart the tests, please check the ["If your build fails" wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/If-CI-checks-fail-on-your-PR).
- See the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia's-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers) for what code owners will expect.

pr_title: Fix #17861: Adds heading tag in Contributor dashboard and changes h1 to h2 in the dashboard page
pr_body:

<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes #17861 
2. This PR does the following: Adds h1 to the main title of the page and also changed the h1 to h2 on the page according to the [W3 heading structure](https://www.w3.org/WAI/tutorials/page-structure/headings/)

## Essential Checklist

pr_title: Fix the color contrast of the oppia lesson tile
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of #16960 
2. This PR does the following: 
- Changed the color of the oppia lesson tile as they were not adhering to the[ w3 AA standards](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/contrast-minimum.html)
- Here is a list of all the tiles that are changed -- [Doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1e8cJR7_HilR0K45fJJD3dWYXxW-_3RXFNkAefvd4spc/edit?usp=sharing)
- The mocks are approved by the Conor from the design team -- [Mocks](https://www.figma.com/file/ELTCeiMtzBEK2tI2OlIroL/Color-contrast-mocks----Patel-Muhammad?type=design&node-id=0%3A1&t=gLPacoOtVTMuLGuS-1)

pr_title: Fix #18202:  Fixed the hierarchy of the ul and li in the creator dashboard exploration tile metrics
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of #18202 .
2. This PR does the following: Changed and fixed the ul and li structure in creator dashboard to solve the axeDevtools error

## Essential Checklist

- [x] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [x] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed locally on your machine.
- [x] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
  - This lets reviewers restart your CircleCI tests for you.
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".

## Proof that changes are correct

<!--
Add videos/screenshots of the user-facing interface to demonstrate that the changes
made in this PR work correctly. If this PR is for a developer-facing feature,
provide the videos/screenshots of developer-facing interface.

After:

*Please not*:  
- There is still the color contrast issue for the exploration tile that is fixed this PR #18328 
- Also, the number of tiles in the "after" screenshot is more than that of the "before" one , so overall there are more issues seen in "after" screenshot. But, these all 46 issues in the "after" are just for the color contrast, the ul and li related issues are solved (you can see in the screenshot in after, it has just color contrast issues that is fixed in another PR #18328 )

pr_title: Fix screen reader issues while navigating Creator dashbard page
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

This PR fixes parts of the Project Manager demo remarks for my GSoC project -- Improve accessibility

1. This PR does the following: 
- In the average rating tab, the “(by 2 users)” is not read
- “Open Feedback” is read as “Total Feedback” same with the “Subscribers”
- The “Explorations” text is not read
- The “Embed this exploration” is not working
- The ascending / descending arrow is not accessible
- The table is not accessible using screen reader

Done, PTAL.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 6, 28, 16, 49, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1248905755, 'comment_body': 'Do we have any mock for the UI/UX for this bar (suggested/created by UI/UX team)? if not, I would suggest asking UI/UX team members to create one.

I have the following suggestions/concern:
- I'm not sure whether "RTE" is a popular term and can be understood by translators, should we use a different term? 
- Do we need to keep this in brackets `()`? (Maybe an "i" icon and hover should show a pop-up (not sure!))
- This is written just below the "Copy tool" and seems like related to copy-tool, maybe a better placement? ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 1, 17, 31, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1248905971, 'comment_body': 'add `oppia-` prefix to avoid conflicts with any third party selectors.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 1, 17, 32, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1248906883, 'comment_body': "This is for the hint's editor and not interaction, right?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 1, 17, 37, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1248906896, 'comment_body': 'Ditto*', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 1, 17, 37, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1248907502, 'comment_body': 'Are we expecting the first letter to be capitalized? (I see it capitalize for the expand section)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 1, 17, 40, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1248908451, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
             aria-label="Expand answers and responses"
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 1, 17, 41, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1248908455, 'comment_body': 'Ditto*', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 1, 17, 41, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1248908540, 'comment_body': 'Fix the label here and in other places', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 1, 17, 42, 15, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1248908755, 'comment_body': 'Do we need `keydown.enter` here as well? (not sure!)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 1, 17, 43, 58, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1248909037, 'comment_body': 'Just to confirm, why are we making these changes and can you please share a before/after screenshot of the UI of this change? (This will help me understand the changes better and ensure I follow these color schemes while reviewing future PRs.)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 1, 17, 46, 44, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1248909461, 'comment_body': 'Will it change the size of the text significantly? Also, do we need to make a similar change for the translation suggestion review model component?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 1, 17, 51, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1248909532, 'comment_body': 'WHy do we need this change?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 1, 17, 52, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1249238360, 'comment_body': "@DubeySandeep we don't need to use the keydown.enter event here. The element in question is already a button, and its type is already specified, so the keydown.enter behavior is already applied to it.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 2, 5, 33, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1249241906, 'comment_body': '@DubeySandeep As the oppia-question-header was changed hrom h3 ---> h1 we need to ensure that the size and margins are maintained.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 2, 5, 39, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1249242585, 'comment_body': '@DubeySandeep please refer this comment https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/18427#discussion_r1248909532 the size of the text is maintained. Thanks.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 2, 5, 40, 12, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1249245537, 'comment_body': 'Yes, you are right, I missied that. I have made the changes to the translation suggestion review model component PTAL. Thanks ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 2, 5, 45, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1249247468, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 2, 5, 48, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1249247587, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 2, 5, 48, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1249247970, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 2, 5, 49, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1249250810, 'comment_body': 'No there is no neccessity for the first letter to capital or small. All screen readers will say it the same. The only problem is when the letters are all caps(that is not the case with this), then the screen reader will read the letters seperately.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 2, 5, 53, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1249252176, 'comment_body': 'Done, thanks!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 2, 5, 55, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1249274686, 'comment_body': 'To give you more context: This PR is related to my GSoC project -- Improve accessibility 

This color of the text is having very low color contrast ratio with the background, and is failing to even maintain the w3 AA Standards (https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/contrast-minimum.html) the color contrast ratio can be seen here: 

Before: https://webaim.org/resources/contrastchecker/?fcolor=009688&bcolor=FFFFFF

After: https://webaim.org/resources/contrastchecker/?fcolor=00645D&bcolor=FFFFFF

I hope this helps in giving you a better idea. Let me know if you need any further info, thanks!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 2, 6, 30, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1249279632, 'comment_body': 'Before:

After:
![1 - after](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/4524155d-c24c-446e-9228-3ec36cbf25bc)
', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 2, 6, 37, 12, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1249282414, 'comment_body': 'Yes this is for the hints editor -- for the down&up collapse&expand arrow in hints editor ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 2, 6, 41, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1249282430, 'comment_body': 'Yes this also is for the hints editor -- for the down&up collapse&expand arrow in hints editor ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 2, 6, 41, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1250169735, 'comment_body': 'Is this resolved? pr_title: Fix - #18145  - #18116  - #18115  - #18120 - #17211  - #17948  - #17212 : Fixed a11y issues with the story player page
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes: 
- #18145 
- #18116 
- #18115 
- #18120
- #17211 
- #17948 
- #17212 

3. This PR does the following: 
- Adds focus to the previous skill and next skill
- Adds focus for lessons, practice and revisions tab
- Changed the alt of the revisions tab icon
- Added h1 tag in story player page, practice tab and practice sessions page
- Fixes In practice session lint not having name

## Essential Checklist

- [x] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [x] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed locally on your machine.
- [x] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
  - This lets reviewers restart your CircleCI tests for you.
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".

pr_title: Fix #16890: Made the Drag and Drop interaction accessible so that Drag and Drop can be done using keyboard.
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes part of #16890.
2. This PR does the following: Added style and functions for the drag and drop interaction so that drag and drop can be done using keyboard.

## Essential Checklist

- [x] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [x] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed locally on your machine.
- [x] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
  - This lets reviewers restart your CircleCI tests for you.
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".

## Proof that changes are correct

<!--
Add videos/screenshots of the user-facing interface to demonstrate that the changes
made in this PR work correctly. If this PR is for a developer-facing feature,
provide the videos/screenshots of developer-facing interface.

Please also include videos/screenshots of the developer tools
browser console, so that we can be sure that there are no console errors.

If the changes in your PRs are autogenerated via a script and you cannot provide proof
for the changes then please leave a comment "No proof of changes needed because {{Reason}}"
and remove all the sections below.
-->

#### Proof of changes on desktop with slow/throttled network


https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/0208fec0-f7f0-49a4-b553-a876c4ee958e


https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/3b4fd433-d725-46fe-9efb-6b69e8fb5a94

Make sure to properly verify that everything works correctly, and that there are
no weird UI mistakes or other problems. Also, if there are any newly added fields,
try to fill them out and test that different inputs are correctly accepted/rejected.

Throttle the network (to 3G) using the browser Developer Tools (see references below).
There should be no performance or UI issues while the network is slow.

References:
 - Chrome: https://css-tricks.com/throttling-the-network/
 - Firefox: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Network_Monitor/Throttling
-->

-->

If the PR changes the UI, make sure to add screenshots with the site
language set to Arabic as well (we use Arabic as it is a language written from right to left).
-->

## PR Pointers

- Make sure to follow the [instructions for making a code change](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Make-a-pull-request).
- If you need a review or an answer to a question, and don't have permissions to assign people, **leave a comment** like the following: "{{Question/comment}} @{{reviewer_username}} PTAL". Oppiabot will help assign that person for you.
- For what code owners will expect, see the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia's-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers).
- Make sure your PR follows conventions in the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays.
- Never force push. If you do, your PR will be closed.
- Some of the e2e tests are flaky, and can fail for reasons unrelated to your PR. We are working on fixing this, but in the meantime, if you need to restart the tests, please check the ["If your build fails" wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/If-CI-checks-fail-on-your-PR).

2. This PR does the following: Added functionality for using image interaction and graph interaction using keyboard for imporivng the accessibility of the interactions

In some cases this is not needed (e.g. for pages that we do not expect to
support mobile phones, or for backend-only features).

Feel free to use the Developer Tools emulator for this.

References:
 - Chrome: https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/device-mode/
 - Firefox: https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/devtools-user/index.html#responsive-design-mode
-->


<!--
If the PR changes the UI, make sure to add screenshots with the site
language set to Arabic as well (we use Arabic as it is a language written from right to left).
-->

## PR Pointers

- Never force push! If you do, your PR will be closed.
- Make sure your PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays.
- Some e2e tests are flaky, and can fail for reasons unrelated to your PR. We are working on fixing this, but in the meantime, if you need to restart the tests, please check the ["If your build fails" wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/If-CI-checks-fail-on-your-PR).
- See the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia's-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers) for what code owners will expect.
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 1257353162, 'comment_body': 'Start all CSS classes added by us with "oppia", to distinguish from third-party classes.

Not sure what "accessibility dot" means, too. Maybe choose a more descriptive name?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 8, 20, 38, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1257353214, 'comment_body': 'Not sure what "dot" refers to here. "cursor", perhaps? I think in general you might want to use "cursor" rather than "dot" for this because it connotes "the thing that blinks and indicates where on the screen a user is making their edits".', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 8, 20, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1257353349, 'comment_body': 'Names of variables measuring distances/etc. should have units.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 8, 20, 40, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1257353399, 'comment_body': 'Maybe explain what the significance of "2" is.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 8, 20, 40, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1257353432, 'comment_body': 'Same notes as before.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 8, 20, 40, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1257353749, 'comment_body': 'Can simplify all this to: `this.usingMobileDevice = !!this.deviceInfoService.isMobileDevice()`

(maybe also rename to `usingMobileDevice` since `isMobile` starts with a verb and thus suggests a function rather than a boolean variable)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 8, 20, 41, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1257353808, 'comment_body': "Not sure a user would understand this; what is the best practice for labelling input fields? Is it with an instruction or a description of what's typed there? (Perhaps point to a reference that supports what you decide to go with.)", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 8, 20, 42, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1257458038, 'comment_body': 'Labels need to describe the purpose of the form control. PTAL at this from [W3 guidelines](https://www.w3.org/WAI/tutorials/forms/labels/)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 9, 10, 44, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1257461816, 'comment_body': '@seanlip what do you think of: `oppia-accessibility-dot-to-add-node` (because this dot is only active and helps user if the user selects the `add node` option)?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 9, 11, 9, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1257462337, 'comment_body': 'the `this.state.currentMode == 2` signifies the `add node` option is active, that is when the accessibility dot has to be shown', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 9, 11, 13, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1257463256, 'comment_body': '@seanlip In the same component we use `mouseX` and `mouseY` names as well, still do you think "cursor" would not create confusion? pr_title: Add topic player, story player and classroom page to lighthouse files
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR does the following: Added story player, topic player, classroom page to keep check for the lighthouse test score to be 1 and prevent it from regression.

## Essential Checklist

- [x] The **PR title** starts with "Fix #bugnum: " or "Fix part of #bugnum: ...",
followed by a short, clear summary of the changes.
- [x] I have followed the [instructions for making a code change](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Make-a-pull-request).
- [x] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed on my local machine.
- [x] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
- [x] I have assigned the correct reviewers to this PR (or will leave a
comment with the phrase "@{{reviewer_username}} PTAL" if I don't have
permissions to assign reviewers directly).



## Proof that changes are correct
N/A (See the lighthouse ci test logs)


<!--
Add videos/screenshots of the user-facing interface to demonstrate that the changes
made in this PR work correctly. If this PR is for a developer-facing feature,
provide the videos/screenshots of developer-facing interface.

Please also include videos/screenshots of the developer tools
browser console, so that we can be sure that there are no console errors.

The above should be done for all PRs, including short ones (e.g. a single-line change).
However, if the changes in your PRs are autogenerated via a script and you cannot
provide proof for the changes then please leave a comment "No proof of changes
needed because {{Reason}}" and remove all the sections below.
-->

<!--
Make sure to properly verify that everything works correctly, and that there are
no weird UI mistakes or other problems. Also, if there are any newly added fields,
try to fill them out and test that different inputs are correctly accepted/rejected.

Throttle the network (to 3G) using the browser Developer Tools (see references below).
There should be no performance or UI issues while the network is slow.

References:
 - Chrome: https://css-tricks.com/throttling-the-network/
 - Firefox: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Network_Monitor/Throttling
-->

<!--
In some cases this is not needed (e.g. for pages that we do not expect to
support mobile phones, or for backend-only features).

Feel free to use the Developer Tools emulator for this.

References:
 - Chrome: https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/device-mode/
 - Firefox: https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/devtools-user/index.html#responsive-design-mode
-->


<!--
If the PR changes the UI, make sure to add screenshots with the site
language set to Arabic as well (we use Arabic as it is a language written from right to left).
-->

## PR Pointers

- Never force push! If you do, your PR will be closed.
- Make sure your PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays.
- Some e2e tests are flaky, and can fail for reasons unrelated to your PR. We are working on fixing this, but in the meantime, if you need to restart the tests, please check the ["If your build fails" wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/If-CI-checks-fail-on-your-PR).
- See the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia's-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers) for what code owners will expect.

[{'comment_id': 1281831522, 'comment_body': "It doesn't look like you're using square bracket notation here, so why do you need to disable this rule? For reference, here is the documentation for this rule: https://eslint.org/docs/latest/rules/dot-notation", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 2, 12, 25, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1281832175, 'comment_body': 'Why is catching the error, printing it, and then quitting better than just letting the error propagate normally?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 2, 12, 26, 15, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1281846948, 'comment_body': "@U8NWXD Please look the above functions:  getSkillEditorUrl, getStoryEditorUrl, getTopicEditorUrl. They all exit if the error is occured, also when there is an error it means that the story player and topic player urls won't be available to run the lighthouse on them, so it will give error then. Do you still think I should remove the exit?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 2, 12, 39, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1281882727, 'comment_body': "Is 20,000 not too much? I've not seen a timeout this big anywhere else in the repo", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 2, 13, 9, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kapilag96', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1281893509, 'comment_body': 'Hi @kapilag96 yep, I have now changed to 15,000. Please take a look thanks!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 2, 13, 18, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1281900286, 'comment_body': 'This blocks for 15 seconds. Do you need a timeout that large?

Also, please see if you can utilize use Frame.waitForSelector(), Frame.waitForXPath() or Frame.waitForFunction() (see remarks in https://pptr.dev/api/puppeteer.page.waitfortimeout)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 2, 13, 23, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kapilag96', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1281912657, 'comment_body': 'Hi @kapilag96 thanks for pointing. Please take alook at the functions `getStoryEditorUrl`, `getTopicEditorUrl`, `getExplorationEditorUrl` in the same file, there we have used `page.waitForTimeout` and also used 15000. For this use case the data takes a liitle while to get loaded, so I have used 15000. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 2, 13, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1281917880, 'comment_body': 'Thanks for pointing @U8NWXD I have removed that PTAL. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 2, 13, 36, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1281921006, 'comment_body': 'What are we waiting for with this timeout?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 2, 13, 38, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kapilag96', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1281927008, 'comment_body': 'We are waiting for the data of the topic and story to be generated in the admin page.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 2, 13, 42, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1281929855, 'comment_body': 'And is there no way to know that the data was generated without waiting for a timeout? Where is the data stored?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 2, 13, 44, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kapilag96', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1281938923, 'comment_body': 'I think for now there is no way to know data was generated, if any error is there that will be caught. The data for the 2 topics are being generated from the admin page.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 2, 13, 51, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1281942899, 'comment_body': 'Ahh thanks for pointing out the previous functions. I agree with staying consistent', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 2, 13, 54, 7, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'U8NWXD', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1281954667, 'comment_body': 'We are setting a status message when this data is successsfully loaded? Can you check if we can use that instead of a timeout?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 2, 14, 2, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kapilag96', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1282313582, 'comment_body': 'Hi @kapilag96 I tried to find out a way to use that in this commit: b33242ca57e4d4328c9b2a3e48775b6ff4c181bb
But there might be sometiming issue still causing this test to fail. In my opinion 15,000 will work, as we have used that in the codebase for funtions in the same file (see getStoryEditorUrl, getTopicEditorUrl, getExplorationEditorUrl). 

![image](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/73adbf1c-a6f9-44ce-a932-b3ec0f4927f4)
', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 2, 19, 9, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1282597883, 'comment_body': "Don't load data structures using `adminPageComponent.loadNewStructuresData`. In an E2E test, you interact with the web page and see the results as if you were the user. 

Try this: click on the generateTopicButton as you already are currently doing. We set a status message for the end user ([here](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/dd4e4defab5abbba17bbc1d99f406d850ea0f68c/core/templates/pages/admin-page/activities-tab/admin-dev-mode-activities-tab.component.ts#L151)) that is rendered on the web page. See if you can find the element that is rendering that message and wait until that element and the exact message have both appeared.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 3, 3, 18, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kapilag96', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1282851288, 'comment_body': "Do you need to wait for navigation twice? Doesn't `waitUntil: networkIdle` above it accomplish the same thing?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 3, 8, 39, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kapilag96', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1282851836, 'comment_body': 'Why do we have 2 blank lines below this line?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 3, 8, 40, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kapilag96', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1282858523, 'comment_body': 'I have changed that in recent commit PTAL', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 3, 8, 44, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1282859920, 'comment_body': 'I haved fixed that in recent commit, PTAL', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 3, 8, 45, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1282875648, 'comment_body': '@Patel-Muhammad please check again', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 3, 8, 56, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kapilag96', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1282879179, 'comment_body': 'PTAL at this commit https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/18724/commits/5625c32224a4dbda65455dc4abceee1becb035e3

pr_title: Fix #17863: Added help text for RTE accessibility menu
pr_body:

<!--

1. This PR fixes #17863
2. This PR Adds help text for RTE accessibility menu
3. Additional context:
- We use cke editor for the rich text, that already has the keyboard accessiblity shortcuts and fucntionality([see here](https://ckeditor.com/docs/ckeditor4/latest/features/shortcuts.html#accessibility)). 
- The fix for this issue is to add a help text for the users so they can access the accesiblity menu, the solution to this issue is similar to this #18427, here designers had suggested me to add the help text with appropriate stylings, that I have used here.

- To reply to reviewers, follow these instructions: https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Make-a-pull-request#step-5-address-review-comments-until-all-reviewers-approve
- Some e2e tests are flaky, and can fail for reasons unrelated to your PR. We are working on fixing this, but in the meantime, if you need to restart the tests, please check the ["If your build fails" wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/If-CI-checks-fail-on-your-PR).
- See the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia's-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers) for what code owners will expect.
pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 1382403201, 'comment_body': 'Why is this removed?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 11, 4, 14, 15, 28, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Lawful2002', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1382407358, 'comment_body': '@Lawful2002 This is removed because when ever any page/modal is being loaded which has has the ckeditor, then the focus directly jumps to text box -- resulting in unordered naviagtion for screen readers and keyboard users. To avoid this behaviour the has to be removed. Hope this answers your question. Thanks!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 11, 4, 14, 38, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1382409119, 'comment_body': 'Yup, thanks!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 11, 4, 14, 44, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Lawful2002', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Fix accessibility issues with signup page and contact page + make lighthouse score 1
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes accessibility issues while navigating the signup and contact page and make the lighthouse score to 1.

## Essential Checklist

- [x] The **PR title** starts with "Fix #bugnum: " or "Fix part of #bugnum: ...",
followed by a short, clear summary of the changes.
- [x] I have followed the [instructions for making a code change](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Make-a-pull-request).
- [x] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed on my local machine.
- [x] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
- [x] My PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide).
- [x] I have assigned the correct reviewers to this PR (or will leave a
comment with the phrase "@{{reviewer_username}} PTAL" if I don't have
permissions to assign reviewers directly).

## Proof that changes are correct

https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/8cd3310c-8efc-499e-bc6d-8f930ce2ba59


https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/e7977cfe-e8b9-4bed-8141-7824d240cd57


<!--
Add videos/screenshots of the user-facing interface to demonstrate that the changes
made in this PR work correctly. If this PR is for a developer-facing feature,
provide the videos/screenshots of developer-facing interface. Please also include
videos/screenshots of the developer tools browser console, so that we can be
sure that there are no console errors.

When you make updates to the PR, please update these videos/screenshots as well.
You can drop videos/screenshots from previous versions of the PR.

The above should be done for all PRs, including short ones (e.g. a single-line change).
However, if the changes in your PRs are autogenerated via a script and you cannot
provide proof for the changes then please leave a comment "No proof of changes
needed because {{Reason}}" and remove all the sections below.
-->


## PR Pointers

- Never force push! If you do, your PR will be closed.
- To reply to reviewers, follow these instructions: https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Make-a-pull-request#step-5-address-review-comments-until-all-reviewers-approve
- Some e2e tests are flaky, and can fail for reasons unrelated to your PR. We are working on fixing this, but in the meantime, if you need to restart the tests, please check the ["If your build fails" wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/If-CI-checks-fail-on-your-PR).
- See the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia's-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers) for what code owners will expect.
pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 1305232850, 'comment_body': 'Is there any specific reason for adding `#052b6c` to the link? (I assume we already have `#0844aa` to anchor tag. [oppia.css:465])', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 25, 6, 33, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1305238462, 'comment_body': '@DubeySandeep the color contrast is not upto the mark as per the W3 aa standards that is causing the axeDevtools test to fail.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 25, 6, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1305466227, 'comment_body': 'Thanks for the explanation, @Patel-Muhammad ! Can you please check why `#0844aa` [oppia.css, line 465] works for all other places and not here? Also, do we use `#052b6c` for links in other places in the codebase?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 25, 10, 5, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1305582323, 'comment_body': '```suggestion ``` Use data interpolation for variables with non-HTML values, here and elsewhere', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 25, 12, 11, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Lawful2002', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1305582544, 'comment_body': 'Ditto', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 25, 12, 11, 34, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Lawful2002', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1305582717, 'comment_body': 'Ditto', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 25, 12, 11, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Lawful2002', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1305583123, 'comment_body': 'Any reason for removing the alt text?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 25, 12, 12, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Lawful2002', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1306609445, 'comment_body': 'The alt text is not conveying any relevant useful information to the user as this is for the thumbnail, @Rijuta-s had suggested me earlier for similar case senario to remove the alt text and keep it blank.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 27, 6, 41, 38, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1306610019, 'comment_body': 'I am not sure if we should change the color at all places in the codebase, there may be the situation where the font size of the link at other places is large or the background is different so the test may not fail there. Although I believe that it is a thing that can be thought out properly then be implemented.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 27, 6, 46, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1308773152, 'comment_body': "I'm not asking to add a new color to all the links, instead, I'm worried about managing two different colors for links. (Maybe we are already have different colors for link) > Can you please check why #0844aa [oppia.css, line 465] works for all other places and not here? Also, do we use #052b6c for links in other places in the codebase? Answers to these^ questions will definitely help us resolve this thread!", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 29, 12, 52, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1315632341, 'comment_body': '@DubeySandeep I didnt find any other links that are using that color in the codebase, mostly the anchor tags are inside buttons and having different background. Let me know if I am missing something.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 5, 9, 26, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1335720215, 'comment_body': '@Patel-Muhammad Is it possible to move this style to the related contact page css file?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 25, 10, 52, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1335740305, 'comment_body': '@DubeySandeep has a good point, we do need to verify consistency here. This is a green link on white background right? If so we should ensure that those links are represented the same way throughout the codebase. @Patel-Muhammad to be clear, are you saying that (a) there are no other green links on white backgrounds throughout the site, or (b) there are green links on white backgrounds elsewhere but there is a specific reason to use a different colour here? Please clarify and include screenshots if needed. We should have one set of colours for this use case throughout the whole codebase.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 25, 11, 13, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1351607259, 'comment_body': 'Hi @DubeySandeep @seanlip instead of changing color, i have added underline to the mail, that is fixing the lighthouse error. PTAL. And on moving the class to the contact page related css, the style does not apply, so I have to keep it in oppia.css ![Screenshot from 2023-10-12 14-49-35](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/a49e297b-ae0c-4b1f-a5e0-2dda53b694a6) ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 10, 6, 28, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1356640308, 'comment_body': "> And on moving the class to the contact page related css I was not expecting this, do we know why it's not working? Can you please look into dev tools and see why/which style is over-riding it? ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 12, 10, 50, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1356658196, 'comment_body': '@DubeySandeep Actually, no style is overriding it, the style is not applying on the text in the first place.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 12, 11, 6, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1359833486, 'comment_body': "is that expected? Also, do we know why it's not working from the component style page but working fine from the global css page? (Asking this as we are expecting this style to be written in the component css)", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 15, 8, 36, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1362973909, 'comment_body': "@Patel-Muhammad I assume you assigned me to this PR because of this comment thread ... but I have the same comment as Sandeep. What's the actual issue here?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 18, 1, 9, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1363951784, 'comment_body': '@seanlip @DubeySandeep the reason for the class not applying for this may be that the content is there in the en.json file', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 18, 14, 7, 12, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1364081879, 'comment_body': "@Patel-Muhammad I don't understand what you mean. Could you please elaborate on the reasoning?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 18, 15, 24, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1364753375, 'comment_body': '@seanlip if you see line 248: "For general questions, please reach out to admin@oppia.org", here the class "oppia-contact-mail" is given. And this content is there in the en.json file, so it is shown to the user by using : I18N_CONTACT_PAGE_OTHER_INQUIRIES_PARAGRAPH_1, I think that may be the reason that the class(oppia-contact-mail) is not applying if I put it in contact page related css.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 19, 1, 3, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1367694680, 'comment_body': 'Hi @DubeySandeep please take a look at the comment and let me know if it is still an issue.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 21, 9, 12, 16, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1367837575, 'comment_body': 'Hi @DubeySandeep @seanlip can you please take a look at the reply and let me know if you have any concerns?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 22, 5, 0, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1371566438, 'comment_body': 'Would you mind sharing the following devtools screenshot with the new changes: ![image](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/16653571/4c30d251-bd26-46c4-bce9-a45bdb71b8f2) This will help us understand which style is getting applied.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 25, 11, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1373588182, 'comment_body': '![PHOTO-2023-10-24-21-59-23](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/68547101/d55a8fb3-8828-42a4-bb52-fac598cf518c) `text-decoration: none` is being applied currently. @Patel-Muhammad Please add devtools screenshot with the new changes. Added this for more clarity.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 26, 18, 22, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Rijuta-s', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1374072063, 'comment_body': '@DubeySandeep I have tried multiple approaches and this is the summary for each: I have tried three approaches to solve this error (all failed): 1. ``` .oppia-contact-page-content p a { text-decoration: underline; } ``` In the file: `oppia/core/templates/pages/contact-page/contact-page.component.html` 2.Adding inline style to the a tag: ``` "I18N_CONTACT_PAGE_OTHER_INQUIRIES_PARAGRAPH_1": "For general questions, please reach out to [admin@oppia.org](mailto:admin@oppia.org)." ``` I have given inline style underline but this is also not working(the style is not applied, as seen from the inspect tab) 3. Adding a class to the a tag and targeting it in the contact page (oppia/core/templates/pages/contact-page/contact-page.component.html) ``` "I18N_CONTACT_PAGE_OTHER_INQUIRIES_PARAGRAPH_1": "For general questions, please reach out to [admin@oppia.org](mailto:admin@oppia.org)." ``` And I targeted this class in the contact-page.component.html: ``` .oppia-contact-mail{ text-decoration: underline; } ``` This is also not working. As seen from the inspect page, the class is applied to the a tag but the style does not apply. this is the devtools ss for all above 3 cases: ![Screenshot from 2023-10-27 10-23-58](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/ca55f7b6-0b90-4445-816e-88af45493ca4) In addition the tag has a style form third_party.css to make text-underline as none, that I can override if the class is targeted in oppia.css. For conclusion the only way it is working is targeting the class in the oppia.css See this screenshot the style is getting applied on if i put it in oppia.css ![Screenshot from 2023-10-27 10-25-41](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/8c7850bd-3549-4a09-8b57-43675bd172a8) ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 27, 4, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1375302345, 'comment_body': '@Patel-Muhammad Have you tried a more specific CSS selector, e.g. `a.oppia-contact-mail`? In general specific selectors "win" over more general ones, and it seems like you have two selectors that are competing for the same element here. (I don't think it has anything to do with the class being specified in en.json like you mentioned previously.)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 28, 18, 14, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1375416074, 'comment_body': 'Hi @seanlip I think there is some misunderstanding, please see the point 3. in the thread above, I have used the specific selector but it does not work.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 29, 11, 12, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1375631682, 'comment_body': "@Patel-Muhammad @Rijuta-s Thanks for sharing the screenshot! @seanlip Thanks for the suggestion, I also think this will help us fix the issue. @Patel-Muhammad Can you please follow [Sean's comment](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/18815#issuecomment-1784109850) and fix it? I'll be happy to approve and merge the PR once it's resolved! ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 30, 3, 29, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'DubeySandeep', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1377128829, 'comment_body': '@seanlip @DubeySandeep initially I mis-read your suggestion, I tried adding a.oppai-contact-mail in contact page component, but the style still does not apply: ![Screenshot from 2023-10-31 12-25-28](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/a68a1645-2cb1-4753-af95-0a911671c242) ![Screenshot from 2023-10-31 12-25-54](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/525672ff-2b5e-4d9c-9712-728034d7c186) But if i do the same by defining the style in oppia.css it is working: ![Screenshot from 2023-10-31 12-28-32](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/902c5647-7439-46cd-a644-10a242b708b1) ![Screenshot from 2023-10-31 12-28-20](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/57dbb0ac-a95f-4b49-8a0a-6523a9c6583b) Let me know what should be done. Thanks! ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 31, 7, 0, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1379172146, 'comment_body': 'There are CSS specificity priority rules that determine which CSS rule takes precedence. Try and read them, and use those to figure out what to do next -- we can't give you the answer directly since this needs a bit of digging. You can also try ruling out certain things. E.g. if you think that putting classes in the contact-page component or using en.json causes issues in itself, try applying a `color: red` class (say) and see what happens. If it doesn't apply at all then see if it applies for other CSS selectors in the contact page component. That way we can rule out or confirm the hypothesis that putting CSS in the contact page component doesn't work at all. If the `color: red` CSS shows up then this suggests it's an issue where two selectors are competing for the same element and you'll need to use the CSS specificity rules to figure out what to do. Maybe making the selector even more specific will help. In general please try to show your thought process / debugging mental model (similar to the above) if you can, rather than just "try X and say it doesn't work". That will be more helpful for moving the conversation in the direction of understanding. Thanks!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 11, 1, 18, 39, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1381250609, 'comment_body': '@seanlip I did through debugging as this is the approach and result: I tried to add a sample paragraph tag and added a anchor tag with class oppia-contact-mail in the contact page component: (I did this because this is similar to the paragraph of the mail that is there in the page) ![Screenshot from 2023-11-03 13-10-59](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/ac32120e-d03a-41c1-a331-726f78cae088) The style `.oppia-contact-mail` is also defined in the contact page component. **What should have happened?** The color of all anchor tags with the style `oppia-contact-mail` should be red and underlined. **What actually happened?** Only the style of the sample paragraph tag that I had added for testing, was seen red and underlined: What should have happened? ![Screenshot from 2023-11-03 13-10-22](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/9f37d775-1ba1-43d8-b7e7-bf0d66486c2b) What is the inference? This confirms that when class oppia-contact-mail is defined in the contact page then the anchor tag with class in defined in en.json then the class stylings does not apply to it. @seanlip does this help? ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 11, 3, 7, 53, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Patel-Muhammad', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1381515772, 'comment_body': "Great, that's excellent and much more helpful. Searching for this error brings this up https://stackoverflow.com/a/44215795 and the last two comments in the thread below the solution are probably worth testing (don't use ViewEncapsulation: None). I know you've tested using oppia.css already and we can fallback to that (now that we have a proper rationale for it). But see if the ng-deep one works since that's more targeted (if it does work, add a comment pointing back to the SO thread and explaining what is going on so that future devs understand the context). By using `::ng-deep .oppia-contact-mail` the style is being applied to the anchor tag now: ![Screenshot from 2023-11-03 17-01-25](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/c6bdcb3f-0309-48b2-b4d0-9174fde957d1) I have pushed the changes PTAL.
